I say this because of the terms of subsection 17(2) (b) of the 1996 Act.

Subsection 17(2) provides as follows: “The accused may use or disclose the object or information— (a)  in connection with the proceedings for whose purposes he was given the object or allowed to inspect it, (b)  with a view to the taking of further criminal proceedings (for instance, by  way  of  appeal)  with  regard  to  the  matter  giving  rise  to  the proceedings mentioned in paragraph (a), or (c)  in connection with the proceedings first mentioned in paragraph (b).”
